title: Freely Moving Olfactory Navigation
text:
Welcome to the documentation for Smear Lab’s Freely Moving Olfactory Navigation (FMON) behavioral rig.
This documentation includes a detailed explanation of the rig and the hardware and code that run it.
The rig’s hardware is controlled by a Bpod state machine running in MATLAB and receiving realtime input from Bonsai. All data related to trial state is recorded by Bpod, while all analogue lectrical signals (e.g. sniff signal) are recorded by Bonsai.
The rig can be run either directly from the Bpod Console, or using a custom GUI that was built with specific experiments in mind.

title: About
text: This documentation is organized as a record and reference for the 2023 Build of Smear Lab’s Freely Moving Olfactory Navigation behavioral rig. All materials were produced by Nate Gonzales-Hess for the Smear Lab in fulfillment of his Supporting Area Project in the University of Oregon Psychology PhD Program.

title: MATLAB GUI
text: Instructions for how to use the FMON MATLAB GUI to run experiments
